intro: Hieracium larssonii, commonly known as the Larsson's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine meadows, thriving in well-drained soils and cooler climates. It produces small, yellow to reddish-orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium larssonii is a perennial herb with a rosette of basal leaves and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats.
